channel.title: News API
channel.description: RSS feed based on news api response

item.title: New senator says Hanson booted him from One Nation in 'vitriolic' attack
item.description: Fraser Anning says Pauline Hanson kicked him out of One Nation just hours after he was sworn in, contradicting her claims that he abandoned the party.

item.title: Jacqui Lambie's departure from Parliament could be imminent
item.description: Colourful Tasmanian senator Jacqui Lambie is scrambling to check whether she is a dual citizen.

item.title: Need to renegotiate your NBN plan? Read this first
item.description: Before you get on the phone, here's everything you need to know about your connection and what can be done about it.

item.title: Death toll from powerful earthquake near Iraq-Iran border rises above 300
item.description: More than 300 people are killed and thousands injured after a powerful earthquake strikes in northern Iraq near the Iranian border, officials say.

item.title: Here's what is in the alternative same-sex marriage bill
item.description: Liberal senator James Paterson releases a new same-sex marriage bill which he says offers better religious protections. But Labor says it's a delaying tactic.

item.title: 'This is the hardest thing we've had to write': Second school crash victim farewelled
item.description: The parents of the second boy killed in last week's Banksia Road Primary School crash describe the pain of losing their son as hundreds of people pay their respects during his funeral service.

item.title: Parents reach settlement with IVF clinic after Fragile X passed to kids
item.description: The parents of two boys who inherited an intellectual disability say they can move on with their lives now they have reached a settlement with a Sydney IVF clinic.

item.title: Junior drag racing suspended in WA after girl dies in 'one-in-a-million' crash
item.description: The WA Government temporarily bans junior drag racing as police investigate the death of a girl while driving her dragster.

item.title: Record global CO2 emissions predicted for 2017 after 3-year plateau
item.description: Scientists are predicting a record global carbon emissions level for 2017.

item.title: In Delhi, you can taste the pollution in the air â€” but nobody cares
item.description: Air quality and its impact on health simply isn't a major concern for many Indians.
